Dear Sam:
OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
January 2, 1958
I speak for headquarters as well as for myself when I express
gratitude for your willingness to accept the post of chairman of the
NAEB Research Committee. This is an area in which NAEB has been doing
more and more lately. Bob Coleman gave this committee a lot of time
and thought several years ago. Ray Cheydleur did yeoman service last
year.
Now—with Ray's full approval—we are handing this over to you.
Ray is continuing on the committee, however, and that is good, since
it will give us continuity. Besides, he can help in concluding some
of the activities currently in progress. In fact, you may want to
set up an occasional subcommittee with Ray at its head to wind up
such projects as are in midstream. For your information, a list of
full membership for 1958 is attached. As you know, we have tossed
around by mail-and telephone the question of whether to enlarge the
committee by including some "name" people from outside our ranks.
After giving this much careful consideration, I've decided against
it. We've found that committees become unwieldy if too large, and
furthermore that the costs of meeting become excessive. But, there
is nothing to prevent our setting up an "advisory council," or some
such thing whenever we want to; then we could bring in Foshay,
Lazarsfeld, Nielsen, Hooper, Dick Nixon, et alii.
The Research Seminar held at Columbus (which other NAEB duties
unfortunately prevented my attending) made a strong recommendation
for a full-time research director. This suggestion surely meets with
my approval, and I Imagine gets Harry's okay as well. I shall include
this among the items on the agenda of the Foundation Committee, which
will be meeting within the next few weeks. If put into effect, I
presume it would require funds additional to those now available to us.
Welcome to the ranks of NAEB committee chairmen. And power to
you in your new position!
With best regards for a Happy New Year,
Yours sincerely,
4 Burton Paulu
BPjds President
cc: Harry Skornia, Jack McBride,
Ray Cheydleur, Bob Coleman
